content:
Posted: August 20, 2016
												I am just starting out on it. I have had bad experiences with F1 2014/15. The return of the Career mode was vital. It saves this game and makes it very much playable. Some typical codemaster settings have not gone away. There is a madeningly inconsistant check of 4 wheels on the track. Screenshots show that you can get a penalty for nothing. The same is true for accidents where you can be driven into, you spin uncontrolably, boiunce back on the track, and ....who knew ....it was your fault. But these things are minor. I love a good moan, but this game so far is much better than the previous ones. I love testing, I love the full race distance, I love the warm up laps, I love the atmosphere. A bit more english humour and a more intelligent race engeneer and this would be perfect for me.Thank you to codemaster for finally listening to the fans. More reality, more fun, more story line...and here we are, raised from the dead! Thank you!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 19, 2016
												TL;DR It's very good. For sure Codemasters best F1 game to date. But has notably problems like fairly passive ai. It's also buggy and Codemasters tend to spend little time fixing bugs. Could be truly great if they put effort into improving it.Having done my first two career races I can happily say it's good. Not perfect, not by a long shot. I'd stop short of the glowing review above, but it's good.Notable down sides, bugs, there's quite a few, including a hilarious one where I'd got distracted by real life so had to restart my first race (I hate restarting). Apparently when I restarted, Haryanto was going through a foam sign at the time, so when we restarted I noticed that the game had decided to remember that. His car had foam constantly bouncing out the back of it. It was amusing if not somewhat distracting.My biggest criticism however is the AI doesn't seem as punchy as it was last year (one of last years highlights). They have gone back to the, oh, I'm on the outside, I will back off now mentality. Also, and this annoys me, they refuse to cut across if another car is on the outside around a corner. So in Bahrain where I had a ridiculously good position on the grid compared to Australia, (either luck, learning how to drive or a balance issue) I saw Hamilton and Rosberg spend about 6-8 corners side by side..... That, kinda, wouldn't happen. So it seems the ai isn't aggressive enough. I haven't seen any ai tangle with each other yet.Also, another thing, the ai is weird on the first lap, they all bunch into a close nit line. Now, I don't know if they use different ai on the first lap, or, there's a weird catch up thing going on, (god I hope not), but it feels very weird. They all seem to go the same speed (or close too) After the first lap it's fine though. Once you hit the first round of pit stops there's cars doing all sorts of things, which makes it feel really alive, if not slightly hard to follow.The strategy, both race and long term development is fantastically done. There tyres really feel like a choice. The pit crews often (too often), gives you alternative strategies to switch to during the race. I say too often, because as I was desperately trying to cling to 11th with 2 laps to go in Bahrain (it didn't work, I feel to 14th), it was just, really distracting. No, I don't want to pit with 2 laps to go. Stop asking. Also, stop telling me you'll let me know if there's a storm front on it's way. In Britain, sure, but I'm racing in Bahrain. It just sounds silly. So, the radio is still a bit annoying, even if it is much better. (The options you have to interact and the information you can get are much better).Obviously the game is build to be used with (if you like) voice commands for the pit wall, however I haven't seen any way to actually make it respond to my headset. It would be disappointing if it wasn't in built in this years version, (last years required an external program).Oh, another thing and this really ♥♥♥♥♥ me, I use a G27. If I hit a button on the keyboard, the little tooltips for what each button does relates to the keyboard, it'll tell me F5 swaps pages in the set up screen or something. But if I hit a button on my wheel, all the tool tips turn to Xbox controls. What button on my wheel is X, I ask you. Unless the game is being played with a controller, it should never come up. Why can't the tool tips just reflect what's in the settings menu? Why not let the player customize the out of race bindings as well?Oh, another thing, the VSC is awesome, but, it needs to show your delta in the middle of the screen and have it larger. (I'm sure mods will make this happen). Because the pint sized text box on the right is damn hard to see when you're trying to keep to is through a series of corners as well as trying not to run into anything or miss a braking point. Also, entering the pits, you have to manually slow the car. I like that. But, it's damn hard to make sure you're going 56 and not 61. (Melbourne was not a good race for me).I really like this years game so far. But good god, a lot isn't bugs. It's just, obvious stuff they they either haven't got around to or are oblivious too. It's painfully obvious that it's a port.Worth noting, it runs very well and it's looks good as you would expect. The sound is good, but the volume of the competitors is too high, so you think there's a car coming up behind you and he's actually five or ten seconds behind. There seems little difference in sound between a car on your gearbox and two corners back.So, that's my thoughts so far. Defiantly their best game. Far from perfect. Driving as K-Mag's team mate in the Renault. 0 points for the team so far. Solid start I think. But I am beating K-Mag.A quick few things that are great, the rivalry system is just, amazing. The race starts are fantastic the physics are really a highlight I think. Sound is solid, the career mode is back and is well done. Although, really it should be standard fair. The last bad thing I'll say is this, unlike most games I buy, I have little hope that Codemaster's will significantly address issues with the game (apart from game breaking bugs). The tight schedule means they don't spend any time really improving the game post release. I hope that mods can fix some issues, but from last year they basically killed off the modding scene as they made it impossible to mod most things.

content:
Posted: September 25, 2016
												After 23 hrs playing updatedLets start withCons-I use a wheel, haven't tried the keyboard, but the controller is twitchy. If you find it that way, there is a fix for it, you need to edit action_map_preset_win file, xi_preset1 or preset2 steer left & right deadzone 0.0, I also set saturation to 0.0, try out what works for you. I also add 5 to steering linearity-AI bumps into you too much, hopefully patch will fix it. I drive in a straight line, without trying to block AI & they still run into the back of my car.That's about it for the consPros-AI is challenging on MEDIUM+-Graphics are pretty good-Feels amazing with a wheel (without any adjustments), I usually drop down the force feedback since i find it annoying at 100%-Career mode is pretty amazing-Great physics & cars feel smooth-Love the new engineer updates!-Codemaster keeps putting out patches!-Steam workshop makes it easier to pick Car SetupsKeep up the good work Codey, best racing game I have ever played, hands down!

number of helpful: 5 of 12 people (42%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 7, 2016
												As much as I'd like to give this game a positive review, there's a couple things that make parts of this game unplayable. Now I've been looking forward for the "upgrade to f1 2015", or you know, a complete version of that game. And this game does do that. By implimenting the career mode (and all of its nice little quirks), the game has some definition other than just time trial and quick race. The offline AI are alright, they let you attack pretty easily as to avoid a collision, but actually defend a little bit. My main problem with the game is the online AI. You might think this is one problem who cares, but to me it's extremely prevelent considering I like to play with my mate, but the online AI have something to say about that... We are playing on legend so if it isn't hard enough to keep up and overtake, the AI will literally break poorly (either into you or early in front of you), and completely ignore your existance if you're not the host. Even if you are th host, it's not as good as single player AI, which once again, are just OK.In closing, this is a great single player racing simulator if you like Formula One, but the online is shotty at best at the moment, and Codemasters are literally on vacation 10 months out of the year, so I won't be expecting much of a patch for these AI anytime soon.

number of helpful: 2 of 6 people (33%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 16, 2016
												Overpowered Split stream from the built in AI system carries over to online multi-player making online racing a slipstream fest. Games physics model leave contacts made during close racing and battles pron to accidents,  resulting consequences   are lost/damage front wing or spin. The net-code is better but still needs work as cars will lag and cost you time or damage. The top 10 runners during qualifying gets a tyre wear glitch where they have significantly more tyre wear than the rest of the grid on harder compounds. F1 2016 Will need more fixing and patches as The safety car is back but does not function properly making league races long and boring with no forceful strategy calls. The VSC is also bad, you can accelerate during the VSC period right before green flags gaining an advantage over your rivals. The only thing positive that could be said about F1 2016 is that the handling model is better than F1 2015. 6/10 for me as the game is full of graphical bugs for PC users making driving at times un-raceable as the screen freezes and stutters through out a race. It's sad COdemasters can get a budget build a game on it, make a profit on a release then just leave the current game in it's state. 7 patches does not fix a game which in my opinion was not ready for release.

content:
Posted: January 10
												Garbage AI doesn't have any player awareness, will drive you off the road, sandwich you in turn 1 or rear end you in the braking zone. Have restarted Melbourne Career race a dozen or so times because the AI kept crashing me in the wall whilst not having made it to the first ♥♥♥♥ing pitstop...Safety car is crap aswell, has no ♥♥♥♥ing logic to it. Someone spins out, no crash, no retirees, but hey, whatever right, 4 ♥♥♥♥ing laps of safety car drivel....Someone does crash out, multiple retirees, well who gives a flying f*ck right? No safety car just proceed with your race....I guess Codemasters isn't really a master of code but rather a bloody rookie at coding....This game had potential, given the career research and development, which isn't that great either, you can do all you want with upgrading that Manor, at the end of the career when all teams have done their R&D it's right back at...well, the back. It's also rather rubbish to spend 2 seasons getting a Manor to the front and then deciding, well, on to the next. There's no sense of investment if you can just hop over to the next for a rinse and repeat since well, it doesn't feel like you've build up your car to the max whilst outperforming the other teams....Driving is good enough for 2016ish but the AI, Safety Car and R&D are just lacking, especially the bloody ♥♥♥♥ing AI that can't do anything but put you in the goddam wall.

content:
Posted: August 24, 2016
												Been playing F1 games since Polyphonys 1997. So far this is the most complete F1 game to date. Almost makes up for the disgusting ♥♥♥♥♥how that was F1 2015. To keep this review basic, if you are an enthusiast of F1 this game is well worth the pickup and you will most appriciate all the new features. For a casual fan looking for a good racer, the game works anywhere from full arcade to what i like to think of 'mild-sim' like ProjectCars or Asseto Corsa where its not on rails but no iracing either. You get out of this game what you put into it.Note: being 6hours in I can already tell some things, especially the career mode gimmicks may wear off quick...Most noticeably your agent 'Emma' and your R&D director 'Chris' who are the same generic people you get in every team who say laregly the same things.7/10. Solid game.

number of helpful: 0 of 3 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 19, 2016
Product received for free
												If you are an F1 fan, a driving sim junkie or even a casual racer this maybe worth checking out. The driving mechanics work well and feel responsive. The driving assists and difficulty are fully customizble, so you can set the game up in a way that suits you. An interesting career mode where you get to earn points to reseach car upgrades, there are customizable car setups, practice programes and 21 circuits amongst other things. There is a lot to like here. F1 2016 is a great racing game in all aspects.On top of that the game runs very well, and Ive not come across any bugs or crashes in my time with the game. Highly recommended. This is more fun than I thought it would be. Worth checking out! Codemaster have done a great job with this.The only caution is if you dislike racing around the same ciruit 50+ times, becasue you will be doing that in the full weekend modes. This game require soem patience. It is F1 after all. Also it didnt detect my MS wheel, even though it works in other games and is detected in windows 10. (But the wheel is very old)Check out my full video here (video link will be active at 9am UK 19th Aug/embargo and all)

content:
Posted: March 6
												Codemasters has finally unlocked some features the F1 racing game fans were waiting for since 2010, as the ability to run a full season grid with your friends. There are many other improvements that make it a lot better than 2014 and 2015 versions. If you are a big fan of F1 or Codemasters you must by this game. But in general, I do not recommend you to buy this game. I'm a bit disapointed with some old bugs that are still there. I wish they could run a longer time support to fix these annoying issues, although since the release they fixed countless issues. But every year is the same history within the release of each new game of the franchise - you don't need to go far, look to the other racing titles that still have support and development of enhancements with no extra costs.No support for TrackIR is another negative point for me.If you don't have any F1 Codemaster's game, I recommend you to buy the F1 2013 with the DLC, you won't regret! Or wait for the 2017 version! If you still want to buy this game, please, buy it on sale!

number of helpful: 1 of 8 people (13%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 13, 2016
												What looks like being the best F1 game so far is spoilt by the fact that it is not playable on a fairly high spec PC that runs other Steam games without any problems whatsoever.  Merely completing a quick 5 lap race at Austria makes the game crash to a blank screen resulting in the need to hard reboot my PC.  I can repeat this consistently.  Despite contacting Codemasters directly and being advised to start the game in safe mode and verify the integrity of the game cache, making sure all drivers are up-to-date, this game will not run properly.  What a huge disappointment.  I'd been looking forward to the release of F1 2016 for months.  How could Codemasters have got this so wrong?  It doesn't fill me with confidence about any future titles.  As a software test analyst by profession, it's clear that this game has not been tested properly before release and are relying on gamers who buy the game to identify the issues but don't even bother to fix the issues that are raised.  The issue I'm having seems to be common among other gamers too!  Poor!!  I'd like my money back please!!

content:
Posted: January 23
												This game is a major disappointment. Lets start with control setup using a keyboard and mouse is a no go for me so i used my own logitec game pad...which i had to maually configure. Thats not a real issue but the problem lies with the games failing to streamline the controls in menus for instance my game pad will not work in any menu yet the keybard controls to select left and right are damn F keys!! who the hell uses these huh!?! When im racing i can pause the game with my assigned start button on my gamepad however i cant unpause unless i use the esc key???? I just started playing and i want to throw it out the window with confusing design choices that had me tearing my hair out simply because the in order to progress i had to go through too many menus menus MENUS!!! Hell after a 2 hours i finally start a race only to sit there revving my engine confused as hell telling me to use the clutch (which up to this point was never explained) also the game expects you to read a damn menu during a race to tell you team what you want and of course i can activate it (with the gamepad)but i cant navigate????!! I have to say that after getting burned by this game and a motogp game i WILL NEVER BUY A RACING SIM AGAIN!!!!

content:
Posted: January 24
												If you want to drive a properly simulated F1 car on tracks with no auto spin kerbs, a better setup screen, better AI, and infinitely better handling, go buy Assetto Corsa's Red Pack DLC. If you want to play an officially licensed F1 game with terrible AI, very unrealistic handling (F1 drivers can put the throttle down faster and go on kerbs more than you can here), and a too-simplistic setup screen, then this game is perfect for you. Let's hope codies also gives a better wheel and controller setup screen too, aside from the proper simulation handling and physics which this game should have had.

												I  have the impression to be a beta-tester with a SLI configuration with 2xGTX970 and W7 Pro 64 bit and triple screen at 5880x1080.Changes on 24 August created some modification to the settings. In addition to the previous very annoying and continuous noise buzz that has not been fixed, I have to check and try several settings to finally found the one that remove some blickering and some sort of darker halo two meters in front of the car.I had to put almost everything maxed out in terms of settings for that (except the two "off" recommended by Nvidia for 3D settings: for "particles" and “?). Therefore my fps is averaging 30-36 (without 3D surround of course).I have to say that I consider this game unfinished and therefore I stop to be a beta tester and I return to F1 2012 with the wonderful mods created by the community (realism patch, HD texture for the circuits and the cars etc.) where I can enjoy better quality racing from my cockpit and fps around 100.I will come back and maybe modify my rating when a solid patch settles these issues. In addition the absence of support for TrackIr5 and the engine noise that I hate do not contribute to my desire to come back before these points are fixed (for engine noise: a mod from the community).

number of helpful: 0 of 9 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 30, 2016
												After all the hype, more stuff to play with, the interaction of engineers and your agent, i went ahead and purchased the game, I have been a F1 fan since the 70's and never miss a race, so i donned my gloves and helmet and started to play.Well, talk about shampoo rinse and repeat, i didnt have it on the hardest level as i really dont want to throw my controller at my rather large monitor, but to say i was bored to tears by Monaco was an understatement.I won all but 1 race, even stopped upgrading so they opersition can catch me, but then i fell into a deep sleep at the wheel and never played again.The game to me seems very so so, good GFX and music/sounds, but, its the pratice sessions and qually that bore me, after time when you done that your left with the race, many times i just quit because i just couldnt face the race after all that "junk" to qually and get points in practice to earn better parts.So all in all, i just found it very repetitive, you know what the engineers going to say, you know what your agents going to say and you know you will end up winning.For me, its just another boring F1 game that still falls short of what it really should be, although they did try hard to get it right, there is some sweet spots but for £40 it was a waste of cash, my opinion you may like it as many do, but its a matter of rinse and repeat, a lot!

content:
Posted: August 21, 2016
												I have three reasons why I would recommend not buying F1 2016.. yet?1) This should obviously be driven with wheels and pedals, and Codemasters haven't made that a comfortable experince. There are huge deadzones on both the brake pedal and the throttle pedal. It's especially bad on the throttle. I've simraced for about 8 years and I've never experienced such massive deadzones. There's an aproximately 30% deadzone on the buttom of the brake, and a 25% deadzone on the buttom AND top of the throttle. I have no issues in any other of the racing games/sims that I usually play. This should be easy for Codemasters to fix but it's appalling that such core settings aren't made properly from the start.2) The shiftlights cannot be moved. The last F1 game I bought and played was 2011. It really borthered me that the shiftlight indicators couldn't be moved. I suspect the reason for that is that they need to port their games to consoles, but that's speculation. I wasn't really surprised to see they're still immovable, it is Codemasters afterall.3) The sound is absolutely messed up. Even using the "full soundscale" setting, sound is messed up in a couple of ways. The most obvious is that the other cars are waayyy too loud. Way louder than your own car. Also, there seems to be too few sound channels to handle all the noises when you're running in a large pack of cars, makes the car sound like robots beint brutally mistreated instead of expensive racecars.The game has a lot of potential. I hope codemasters patch the game. The physics are decent, the grapics and framerates are good. I'll change my review once I find the game in an acceptable state.

number of helpful: 4 of 18 people (22%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 24, 2016
												QUICK UPDATE: I'll re-write my review later tonight but I felt it was necessary to say that the replay issues has been patched yesterday. I've been playing the game quite a while now after being able to fix the controller near-decently so I'll re-write it later.First of all, if you have a Steam Controller and plan to play the game with the gyro wheel: DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. It doesn't work.Now, I've read reviews of people saying this was not only the best F1 game ever, but the best RACING game of all times. Are you all high?? I'll make a simple list of game-breaking bugs that are in the game right now.- If you have any controller or wheel other than those officially supported, they won't work.- Even if you have a wheel or a controller listed as compatible, like my Steam Controller or a G27, they still might not work properly.- The Steam Controller comes as supported, they even made a very complicated default config with gyro steering controls... TOO BAD IT DOESN'T WORK IN THE ACTUAL GAME! The game considers the Steam Controller as an X360 gamepad so it applies all the dampening and limitations of a thumbstick to your motion steering wheel, making it IMPOSSIBLE to play. If you want to turn, it will go straight. If you want to go straight, it will turn. You wanna go right? he'll go left instead! Garbage. Absolute garbage.- The AI. Don't get me started. You're driving on your line, on a straight, you're not moving around... BOOM. the AI car behind you decided to go full nuts on your backtrain and crashes you out of the game. They don't even try to overtake you on the free side... I've had a car on the Spa straight after the Eau Rouge that tried to overtake me ON THE GRASS. and then crashed on me!- Performance is terrible. I have an R9380 that can run Doom at ultra at 100 fps and I have to run this game at ULTRALOW (!!) and I can't still do more than 50 fps. Then you go into the flashback/replay, and it drops to 1,5fps, you wait 15 seconds, the replay finally shows up but it runs at 9-10 fps.it's a pity. knowing Codemasters they will now release a couple of patches, two months between each patch because console-patching costs money, and then they will go silent for a couple of months until they will announce their new super hyped F1 2017. this game could have been really good. I believed in that. I believed we could finally have the F1 game we've been promised since 2012. But no, another broken game, promised patches that will bring out more bugs and then Codies will go like "next year it will be better!"if they don't fix this there will be no next year for me. I've already skipped buying the 2014 and the 2015, this one looked promising but I'm out of here seriously if they leave this game like this.

content:
Posted: August 22, 2016
												I thank you for releasing a new F1 game. It's probably the best since 2013. Congratulations. However, the team that develops F1 could have done a much better job if they corporated with the DR team, and also had took a look at other racing games. It's not easy to be the racing company for years, but Codemasters has to acknowledge they are surpassed by other companies now. The list: - No pit-limiter button- No ingame or outgame eyefinity adjustement (Assetto Corsa ingame or Dirt Rally outgame)- No softlock - No wheel rotation or wheel ratio adjustment (270 - 420)-  No option to disable wheel and arms.  (Can be modded. Racedepartement)-  FFB is dead on straights, etc. (No minimum FFB force, etc) - No advanced FFB settings.- Eyefinity is streched. - Bugs here and there. - No trackir/opentrack support. - No camera-adjustment by buttons. -  See-through mirrors. - Can't allow or disallow racingline and other assists in multiplayer racesettings. - Not able to disable  or skip the cutscenes. - If you have more than one device it will keep asking to insert buttons for the other devices- Can't adjust subtitle-frontsize- AI is awful. Always following the ideal line, rubberbanding, braking too much when SC is out, etc- Crashes are hilarious- No marshalls cleaning debris when someone crashed. - Can cut every corner you don't want to cut in real life. - Flashback is a must when blue flag is out or AI overtakes on long straights. They will crash you. - Debris laying on the ground. - No trackrubbering in this game. - and moreI thank you for reading and I wish the F1 team a bright future. Ivy

content:
Posted: September 8, 2016
												They are getting better with this version for sure. I like a lot about it but find that it fails to deliver the smoothness I look for in the graphics, particularly with the anti aliasing effects making everything look a bit jagged in the distance, and for me personally, this is a deal breaker and find that sims such as iRacing have much better AA effects in place. Graphics are not everything of course, and I find the graphics in F1 very decent, although found no way to improve the AA to a satisfactory level even on ultra settings. I wanted to love this game though as they nailed it with all official teams and tracks, which is very cool. No on else out there has the lisence to F1 but codemasters. The career mode seams to be very indepth and well made as well as unique, although the character animations are very cartoon like which puts a damper on giving the game a simulation feel, but the wide array of options settings for the cars and view and such are nice and give a simulation depth. The force feedback seems much better than past versions as do the physics, so well done there.Better AA and better frame rate optimization may have kept this game in my library rather than ending up as a refund. SO close, yet so far away. If the lack of smooth edges in the distance and overall doesn't bother you, or if your system does a better job than mine smoothing them out somehow, this may be right up your alley if you're really into F1. But for me, close but no cigar quite yet.Perhaps next season they'll perfect it and I'll be back with a stellar review...until then....For an in depth unbiased review from inside sim racing, check out my link in the comments section below.For those of you more interested in fanboy comments or perspective written while intoxicated on sublime ganga smoke... check out Tzukasa's replies below.

												I loved the previous f1 games and specially 2014.I played 2015 and did not like it that much i kinda still mis the KERS but its not deal breaking.now in this 2016 i ♥♥♥♥ing hate the game so far, here are my issues with it.- goddamm annoying turbo whistle which you can not disable, best you can do it lower main vehicle sound and max out everything else so it gets muffled with the other stuff going on and even then you still hear it faintly.- controller steering is garbage, when i steer left or right it takes a fraction of a second to respond making it go wobble when you have to avoid impact from a car next to you.- wheel support is eh... but not bad, driving with a wheel is so far the best option because it actually responds right away.- rear view mirror on the top of the screen is gone or atleast i cant find it so this may be my fault.- game HAS to be controlled with keyboard/controller.you can just unplug the mouse because you dont need it anymore for this game.- multiplayer has a mic which is set open by default so expect to hear music or background sounds from atleast 30% of the lobby.so this is quite a big rant so now if you are still reading i will tell you what i like about the game+ driver picking (you can play as whoever you want who is in the current season)+ clutch start (hold clutch, rev up, release clutch)+ better impact of race strategy (you can't expact to win by just driving at full speed 100% of the time in corners #RIPTYRES) + AI don't give no ♥♥♥♥♥ about you, they do not move for you unless you make them physically

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 27, 2016
												F1 2016 is a good game. A very good one indeed. I will start with the pros.The performance of the teams mirrors well (not perfect) the performance of the car in real life. The handling is good, i play with a pad and i can take most corners without problems unlike in previous F1 titles, however if i press throttle just a tiny bit it registers as if I floored it. The same applies for the brakes therefore the rear end can be unstable at times.I really like the fact that if even one wheel hits the grass you can lose control of the whole car which in my opinion makes the game feel more realistic.Simulation damage seems OK but i think it can become even more realistic in future titlesFormation Lap is awesome aswell no pit assistance which give you more immersion. The new starting mechanic looks cool and you can jump start if you are not careful enough. Makes the game more immersive.The career is also very good although upgrading can be done very quickly and make a Manor-Marussia a fronttier fighter by the end of season 1. By mid season you can stop r&d development so that you can focus on next seasons car making the game even more realistic.The new stuff you can ask your engineer is also a nice addition although most of it isnt really helpful you know for example who is in front of you.I also like the AI being more agressive (I play on expert) they will also try to divebomb you from time to time which can cause accidents, the same applies for the start i have spun a couple of times when starting in the middle.ConsMany people who drive dirty in MPThe game registers "Left the track" too harsh. If i for example go a bit further out of the track in time trial my lap will be invalidated. While is true that i left the track you actually get a penalty in real life F1 if you gained an advantage from it (Corner cut excessive squeezing, overtake etc).Hard to Mod. I miss those classic seasons mods like 1999

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 19, 2016
												F1 2016 plays and feels better... with a gamepad, than any previous Codemasters F1 games, plus career mode is back.Graphics, AI, track/car physics, career, safety car and a lot of content well made.But there are some really annoying cons/bugs.No support for TrackIR 5, playing with close up FOV makes it imposible to look at the apex, left/right and mirrors without TrackIR, unless you use 3 screens or VR ofc.Fanatec's Universal Hub for Xbox One buttons can't all get custom remapped, that some are static set in game makes no sense!  As example, custom binding for Pit Limiter?F1 2016 FFB lacks detail compared to F1 2013/2014 with a CSW v.2On top the game looses FFB and the wheel range when restarting tests etc..Can't recommend the game for anything but gamepad, since they removed features that where in the older F1 games, guess there is to much focus on the console version so some of the sim hardware support is left out for PC.Shame on you Cody for making a good looking F1 game with nice gameplay but forgetting the variety of PC sim hardware.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 28
												One of the most solid F1 games I've played since F1 2013. We now have the safety car back after the F1 2015 fiasco we had. The Career mode is pretty awesome and pretty customizable. Various modes to choose from, load times for Time Trial is very very fast which is a nice touch. The ai are more aggressive than probably any F1 game ever made by Codemasters... the F1 Youtuber community has gave tremendous amounts of help by testing out the game and giving their opinion on various things. Communicating with your crew chief is one of the most easiest things to do without taking hardily anytime asking a question or even telling your chief to 'shut up'' which is hilarious. Online is decent I guess.. hardily any lobbies up but thats not really Codemasters fault. I give it a 8.5/10 to be honest. I havent seen any glitches (YET) and the only problem that I had was a D3D error which multiple people are having.

												I've not bought a new F1 game since 2013 and didn't expect to be wowed too much, but the level of detail in this game is amazing. The cars handle properly and it punishes you quite heavily for just holding down the throttle on full and expecting to go in a straight line, career mode is immersive and there's plenty to do in practice making it worthwhile to not skip. 												Finally, F1 is back on track. Codemasters seem to be heading in the right direction with Dirt rally and now this. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 5, 2016
												Ok, to to kick this off, I love the improventements and re-additions to this game. The formation lap, the Safety Car, the various challeges during Practice, to gain upgrades! Awesome stuff!I can't comment on how this game plays with a wheel (don't own one), I prefer a more casual syle - controller with manual gears and tweaked assists & difficulty (Strict track rules, Legend A.I etc)So I'll jump into what I think needs improving (for 'immersion'). The HUB and your race engineer. I feel that to authentisentize (that's a word right?) better to the real life Formula 1, I think each team should have a HUB and an engineer that refects those teams accurately! I.E, a Ferrari engineer who speaks with an Italian accent, a HAAS engineer who is American etc! The graphics are the best I've seen. I'm ultra settings with a GTX 970 Strix, i5 4460, 16GB RAM. 60 FPS at least for me. AA etc maxxed also So game-engine performance is brilliant.So who should buy this. Well I'm sure die-hard F! fans pre-ordered, I did (tho I don't usually pre-order). If your a more casual gamer, read more reviews, buy this game from a key re-seller, if you wish, or buy it on Steam. There's a lot to offer from this lastest itteration.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 2, 2016
												Brilliant. The racing dynamics are so damn good, totally unforgiving so you feel vindicated when you get that corner spot on, gradually lay down the power to keep the rear end in order and hammer it out down the straight. Hooking a perfect lap together is so satisfying, only to be told you're 574th fastest which of course pushes you on to do better, to dominate all opposing you. Your rival is dust in your mirrors, you're about to crush him when you get off line, marbles coat your tyres and you wildly understeer into the final corner, pushing you onto the grass, killing your tyre temps and ruining your lap. You almost see the glee in the eyes of your rival as he shoots past. Cross the line and start again. Victory awaits.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 5, 2016
												It's a game for everyone, that's what I can say. You can set it to easy/medium, disable damage, get grippy stability control and you'll get an arcade for the casual fan. Crank up the difficulty, disable aids, get a good USB steering wheel (I'm using a Logitech DFGT) and you'll get a hard, challenging sim for the true simracer. Although there are more realistic representations of racing cars, I did not buy this expecting iRacing level of quality and physics. Yet this game can be tough. And the AI has improved vastly over the abysmal... thing that was last year's game. They put up a fight against you and between itself. You can get caught up in the middle of a fight, join in, and take advantage of it, just like the real thing. And career mode... holy moly that is awesome.Still haven't tried multiplayer but I hope they take the example of multiple online racers and prevent blatant cheating, or at least avoid being a hackfest like GTA V.Score: 9.8/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 8, 2016
												If Codemasters thought the last 5 iterations of the F1 franchise were a step forward, then this latest one is a rocket to the moon forward. All I can say is that this is the game fans have been waiting on for years. If you are skeptical, I can't blame you, but this is an absolutely outstanding game that brings in features that the community have been asking for. Formations laps, manual starts, pit entries, radio messages to your engineer, it's just crammed full of immersive features that are necessary in an F1 simulator. Unlike previous titles, the track evolution, tyre wear, temps etc are all noticable on performance and managable in a realistic manner. Aside from the occasional crashes which have been and are being patched out (I have already seen a noticible difference since 1.3), there really is nothing I can fault in this game. Finally this franchise is heading in the right direction. Now we just need to hope Codemasters continue this progression and add even more immersive features i.e manually pulling in to your team's garage and pit form the pitlane and driving to your grid position. F1 is no longer just the pinnacle of motorsport but the pinnacle of motorsport games.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 8, 2016
												Really well done F1 racing game. The past years I kept playing F1 2013 because the more recent F1 games were fairly bad, but then F1 2016 arrived. The mechanics of tyre strategies, regulating fuel usage, and in-race strategy changes (suggested by your pitcrew) really make for an engaging race experience. Lots of little details also add to the experience, like giving real voice commands to your pitcrew. The SP career is great, with improved training sessions and the addition of warm-up laps, manual pit entry speed and a real safety car. Online I've had the most fun; racing through a whole season together with a friend, in the same team. TL;DR : 9/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 23, 2016
												F1 2016 is without doubt the best F1 game released by Codemasters in the series so far – it’s obvious they’ve really made the effort to implement what fans have been asking for since F1 2010 – and it’s resulted in a massively immersive F1 experience.The cars and tracks look amazing, racing is exciting and just so much fun, but it’s the career mode for F1 2016 which really shines, especially the new R&D upgrading system in career mode which makes you feel that you are really contributing to the team’s development and rewards you for putting in the extra effort in the Practice sessions.  Also a more “real” feature is your ability to plan your tire selection before the race, and then make later changes during the race if the situation calls for it – just adds to the realism of F1 experience.The formation lap, manual starts and manual pit entry are the icing on the cake – my only wish is that you could manually drive all the way to your grid position and pit stop – perhaps something to look forward to in 2017 (or a 2016 patch?  ). Whilst it’s pretty easy to drive with a controller, I’m now looking to buy a proper wheel and pedal setup to do this game justice.  So far, can’t fault it – job well done Codemasters! 9/10

												I haven't found anything wrong with this game to not recommend it.  It's the cleanest driving experience I've had since racing games back in the early 00s where they were simply clean because detail couldn't be put in them.  Driving is great, the rules are great, the AI is so-so, the career mode is great, safety car is back, etc. I recommend getting it if you like these teams and the tracks of the 2016 season since this is CM's best F1 game I've played (I started getting them in 2010). The only gripe is there's a lack of sheer filth you get in racing which makes tracks look kinda artificial. I know with games the way they are made today, objects can be made to look beat.

												A much improved effort from Codemasters, and perhaps the best Formula 1 game I have played in years. Manual stars and manual pit stops add to a more immersive experience, along with the safety car and the virtual safety car. Overall, the game just feels like more of a simulation than it has in previous iterations.I am quite enjoying career mode, along with the implementation of communicating to the race engineer during a race. Although this can be distracting at times, this can be turn off by telling your race engineer to shut up.There is some slight stuttering of frames, as well as sound, but I would hope this is addressed in time.A few hours in, I do not regret the purchase and I can safely say Codemasters have listened to the community. You really feel like you're in the moment.

												A fantastic edition this year. Really happy to both read and be able to write my own positive review about an F1 Game from Codemasters.F1 2016 is a major improvment over earlier installments and has the best Career mode I have seen to date. Well done, Coddies :)

												First time playing, played it 10 hours straight. What an amazing fun game.The AI is much better and more challenging, I had to lower the difficulty compared to previous games.The game looks gorgeous, even on ultra low (I have a low-end computer unfortunately). Overall runs really smooth, the benchmark allows you to test these settings properly.There are some bugs: one race I couldn't ask things over the radio, and almost during every race the interval timers are off. content:
Posted: August 19, 2016
												As a pessimist to Codemasters ability to make an F1 game, refusing to pre-order and waiting for reviews and day one footage, they proved my intial thoughts wrong. Fantastic game, tough but fun once you've found your sweet spot with your wheel, assists and ai (being Medium Traction and Expert AI for now), and a very in depth career mode (loving the R&D elements).The physics for the car are tough, never would have thought I would need to turn on Medium Traction, and even the 4th strongest AI setting out of 6 is pretty tough for me, as someone who used to play the first F1 games made by Codemasters. No need for ai difficulty mods at the moment, that's for sure.Only come across one bug so far, that being in the replay menu where it may freeze the video of the game when you change camera, forcing you to return to garage. Sounds could also be patched/edited, but nothing at all major and all easily patchable, which is great for a market renowned for poor day one releases, particulary on PC.Would certianly recommend to all F1 fanatics, arcade racers or sim racers.

content:
Posted: September 22, 2016
												A lot has already been said about this game. There's lots to like: the good enough physics that lean toward sim-level quality (not quite but not too far from either), the atmosphere, career, the details, the convincing enough tracks...And there's a few things that could have been better: the graphics are not as good as advertised, even when maxed out. Performance issues and a slight input lag with wheels are not yet solved. And the AI. Overly and recklessly aggressive at times, causing accidents and ramming the player from behind, especially as from Expert and Legendary difficulties, while it also acts too shyly when fighting you over a corner in wheel-to-wheel action, not to mention the long AI trains on straights...All in all, a very good game that should even please a hardcore sim-racer or two.  8/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 19, 2016
												10/10.Quality game.Have bought all the codemasters Formula 1 games since F1 2010 and 2016 is by far the best.Highly recommend this game to anybody who likes any motorsports.Great fun so far.Pros: Graphics wise there is no comparison between the 2015 and 2016 the game is just     immaculate.          Gameplay wise it brings me back to the 2010 game but the features being more in depth. The new features like being able to actually speak to your race engineer is a real bonus because you don't have to go back to the pits every time to check your pace or the forecast. The R&D section in the career laptop has to be one of the brightest ideas codemasters have ever had in their Formula 1 games so full marks for that.Cons: The audio in the game can sometimes be quite trippy depending on how many cars are around you, the game is trying to load the sounds of other cars at a distance while also trying to load the cars nearest to you. Sounds like a good idea but it makes it sound like your speakers are on the verge of breaking.           The A.I are incredibly stupid, they seem not to have any spacial awarness what so ever and at any moment would decide to hit you ( especially when using DRS for some reason ). They also seem to try and make the most ridiculous passing manouvers out there constantly failing and nearly driving off the track.          Last but not least the flashbacks. The flashbacks are perfect bar one thing. Whenever you restart after using the flashbacks the game doesn't automatically move to the direction of which you are pointing, there is a delay after you pressing X on the controller ( Which I personally find most annoying due to the track limit penalties ). I'm not sure whether this problem occurs on racing wheel controller but for Xbox and PS3 controllers it sucks when you need to flashback.All in all very minor issues for the most part but I will stick to my 10/10 due to it's lack of time released.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:

												YES it is a Codemasters Formula One Game.YES they messed up F1 2015 last year.But this game is amazing. I am a pretty big Sim racer, and I race karts competitively in real life, and I can say that the racing expereince is the best that I've seen in an F1 game to date. The features included, the career mode, the way the car handles and the way the tracks feel along the kerbing and fast corners are awesome. The graphics are really good too, and even the minor details of tire rubber splashing onto the TV Pod as you go around the exit kerbing at Circuit Gilles is remarkable. I highly reccomend this game, and this isn't something I say easily about racing sims. If you are a fan of Formula One, this is the game for you.

												FOR ANYONE HAVING ISSUES WITH STEERING WHEELS, CODEMASTERS IS AWARE. IN THE MEANTIME, FOR QUICKFIXES FIXES VISIT CODEMASTERS FORUM OR R/F1GAME ON REDDIT.F1 2016 is a significant improvement over F1 2015; not only in gameplay, but in performace and optimization as well. I will give a quick run down of things I like, and I will update it as I clock more hours in the game.Pros:-Career Mode (So far it started out good, so I'll see what else takes place during it)-Car Development (Puts you against other teams, and allows you to pick the path of the car development)-Pracice Session (FP Sessions now have a purpose, been doing all the test runs.)-Graphics (Look really nice.)-Car Physics (The car handling feels better than 2015, and the extra telementry displayed is a great for referencing how much you should/shouldn't push the car.)-XBOX ONE CONTROLLER IS WORKING FINE NOW!!! Cons:-FPS drop while sitting at the team's lounge (Will most like get fixed soon.)Overall:A really well put together game, certainly makes up for the letdown that F1 2015 was. Worth buying in my opinion if you are an F1 fan. I will add more to the review as time goes.

content:
Posted: August 19, 2016
												Essentially Codemasters have dragged F1 2015 back to the garage and rebuilt it. That's not an insult because they have done a fantastic job. It would be fair to label F1 2016 an iteration but whereas F1 2015 lacked substance and shipped in a woeful state, 2016 is packed and runs great, controls work out of the box and they have tuned up the interface removing lots of small frustrations. Codemasters have clearly changed course and put QC at the top of the list.Graphics are a minor improvement on 2015. On first impressions it looks similiar to 2015 but looking closer you see the details and FX have been bumped up. I've read some previews where they are unimpressed with the graphics but in my mind at least, it looks damned good. I'm running at full detail at 2560x1440 on a 980ti and get a very smooth 60fps. Highly recommended.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 18, 2016
												(First Impressions)Formula 2016 has from my first impression reigned FAR superior than any previous renditions of the official F1 series. The AI seem intelligent, balanced and fair. The driving itself is really entertaining, and somehow they even managed to make tire-wear a FUN challenge.You have tons of customization, R&D and statistics available. Unlike I expected however, it does not at all come off as too complicated or nonsensical. If you're an average f1 fan, you'll have no issue picking up the system, and there's room to expand and tinker if you're an expert.The new race start system is so addicting I found myself doing the Melbourne start 50 times over and over, just to give myself the edge...All in all, a ♥♥♥♥ing fantastic racing game!Post "First Impression" review might follow.

content:
Posted: August 21, 2016
												10/10The game is perfect. No problems with gameplay, or bugs so far.Pros:* Actually playable very very playable(compared with 2015)* Good handling very good handling i play with pad xbox 360+xbox one pad(maybe little but little improvement wants to but ok)* Good graphics* Formation lap gives you a sense of pressure to get your start right!* Manual Starts are a great addition* R&D gives a sense that it is up to you to develop the car right. (Career)* Different cars give you different feels. * Way more options to tune you car for the race e.g ride height is back!* Can choose the total tyres to have for the weekend. (Career)* Doing teams goals in practice are like mini games, they reward you with R&D points so you actually can imporve your car. And in doing so, you also improve your driving skills.* So good game optimization(70+fps all ultra settings at 1920*1080)Cons:- Safety car is to fast(but its fixible in future with patch)- AI can be improved little(but its good for me)- And for now i dont see the sparks(but i know will put to the next patch because this problem It is for all consoles so far).Most of the Cons can be fixed in a future patch, so they are not that big deals.I play with everything on ultra settings, I easily get around 70+fps.So good game optimization.I am running a:i5 4690kgtx 106016gb ram240gb ssd1920*1080p monitorGood work Codemasters on this front.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 23, 2016
												This is the first F1 game I've purchased since F12013. I have to say that Codemasters did a fantastic job with F12016 and I would even go as far as saying this is the best none sim-racing game that depics it's perspective sport very well.I've only put in roughly 10 hours or so in career mode doing full weekends at 50% race distance. Third race in and I'm finding this game very immersive. The practice sessions have a purpose in helping with improving car development for as long as your on the team. AI are the best I've seen in a racing game at this point as well. They are still not purfect but the AI are not affraid to challenge without doing too many stupid stuff. The car handling is a challenge at first in getting a feel for it but all in all a solid job of balancing sim/arcade feel to it. The cornering grip with the different compound tires are done very well as well and feels realistic.Long story short... Codemasters did a fantastic job here and this game was well worth the $50 I spent. I rarely feel I get my money's worth these days in games, but this one is well worth it. I would recommend this purchase to anyone who enjoys circuit racing.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 15, 2016
												After having played every single F1 game except last years I was hoping for some larger changes to the game itself as it had started to become really stale and this year's version of F1 has delivered on improving upon that. F1 2016 is returning to the game I hoped F1 would become over time and it's virtually every thing I wanted, but falls a little short in a few areas.One of the things I wished would change is the career. It had become stale, generic...no podium. It didn't feel engaging. This year improves upon that. It's nice to see your driver have a face and there is a nice clip of a podium etc if you get in the top 3. You soon get sick of these clips though and the novelty wears off.It's kind of the same thing with your R&D rep, who every single time after you complete an upgrade has to come tell you that you have an upgrade. Again, it gets grating. They could of gave him some different animations or different lines and instead he just ends up getting on your♥♥♥♥♥♥ I can also say that about your agent, (I quite like the rival system btw). Who drops a rival on you every now and then, her dialogue becomes boring and old. Starts to rub on you.This stuff is there to try and engage you more and for the first few races it does. After that, it doesn't count for much. So I wish that side of things, was more engaging and kept you engaged. I like the direction its going, just not quite there.The driving, is superb. Now I'm using a controller. I know there have been some complaints about using one. I havent run into any issues at all. It's been great to control, feels good and not too twitchy. Haven't tweaked any settings it just ran fine. All tracks are really well recreated and another improvement from previous games is that you can use some of the kerbs instead of them feeling like they are made of ice.Tyre wear feels better than previous versions. They seem to have nailed the feeling of losing grip and responsiveness of your tyres and when they start to go, you're losing time. The A.I feels competitive too, after patches they have got even better arguably. They fight for positions and if the difficulty meter works well for your own ability, then it makes for some great races. I know that some people have mentioned that the levels up are too tough, to be honest, I'm racing on a level that is perfect for me. Haven't really had this issue. The added safety car adds more depth as well as the mostly pointless formation lap. It's good that it's there though.Performance of the game is a little hit and miss. Patches for me have made the game perform slightly worse in certain areas and better in others. I am using an i5 4690 and GTX 1070 everything is on max and it runs between 60- 80 FPS occasionally CPU usage will spike for no real reason in some inexplicable areas. Like in the pits OR when I am waiting to access the laptop. Just random CPU spikes. Even with Vsync. So it could do with some work optimisation wise I think.On the whole though, I've really enjoyed the time I've spent in single player with this game and I'm certain I'll be spending a lot more. It looks good, plays quite smoothly, drives well, AI is good and theres not a silly amount of bugs.

content:
Posted: August 23, 2016
												F1 2016 is without doubt the best F1 game released by Codemasters in the series so far – it’s obvious they’ve really made the effort to implement what fans have been asking for since F1 2010 – and it’s resulted in a massively immersive F1 experience.The cars and tracks look amazing, racing is exciting and just so much fun, but it’s the career mode for F1 2016 which really shines, especially the new R&D upgrading system in career mode which makes you feel that you are really contributing to the team’s development and rewards you for putting in the extra effort in the Practice sessions.  Also a more “real” feature is your ability to plan your tire selection before the race, and then make later changes during the race if the situation calls for it – just adds to the realism of F1 experience.The formation lap, manual starts and manual pit entry are the icing on the cake – my only wish is that you could manually drive all the way to your grid position and pit stop – perhaps something to look forward to in 2017 (or a 2016 patch?  ). Whilst it’s pretty easy to drive with a controller, I’m now looking to buy a proper wheel and pedal setup to do this game justice.  So far, can’t fault it – job well done Codemasters! 9/10

content:
Posted: September 1, 2016
												Best Codemasters F1 game so far I'd say. Pros:- Handling- Extremely addictive career mode- AI are, from my own experience, the best it's ever been, however...Cons:- ...they pull a Maldonado more than often. Let's take Melbourne, my first career mode race, I'm in a Manor vs Legend AI. Both Renaults had gone a lap down to me due to safety cars and they kept trying to unlap themselves in impossible places, around the outside of the fast chicane for example. And whenever they did manage to pass me, they get blue flags again and slow way down - whilst staying on the racing line ofc. Then there's Canada where Räikkönen sent me across the Atlantic after attempting an overtake on the backstraight. I stay on the racing line, he bails, attempts to pull behind me again and clips my right rear. (I did take Verstappen with me in the crash so maybe it was planned...)- MP, not the game's fault though...- No SLI support

content:
Posted: September 22, 2016
												A lot has already been said about this game. There's lots to like: the good enough physics that lean toward sim-level quality (not quite but not too far from either), the atmosphere, career, the details, the convincing enough tracks...And there's a few things that could have been better: the graphics are not as good as advertised, even when maxed out. Performance issues and a slight input lag with wheels are not yet solved. And the AI. Overly and recklessly aggressive at times, causing accidents and ramming the player from behind, especially as from Expert and Legendary difficulties, while it also acts too shyly when fighting you over a corner in wheel-to-wheel action, not to mention the long AI trains on straights...All in all, a very good game that should even please a hardcore sim-racer or two.  8/10

Posted: December 28, 2016
												Amazing game, best F1 they made in years.I think that the fysics and how the car feel and drive is excellent and it feel more "real" than in previous F1 games.Well it just feel like I am driving a real F1 car, compared to previous f1 games.Sound is also great. the handling of the car is fantastic i think.The career mode is also kind of nice though it is kind of basic just like in previous titles. But you start as a new "rookie" driver in a low standing team. As time goes by and you practice and quality or win races you get tech points that you can invest in your car such as engine/aerodynamics ect.This make the game feel more like a career and what you do and select will as time goes make your car better so you finaly can compete with the top teams. As time goes by you also get some events such as your team expect you to do better than example possition 17.The game have many interesting features such as you during ther race from your wheel in the car can select what tires to pu on in an unexpected pitstop.Damage to the car seem rather realistic, and not only can you see things fall off your car, but also when you touch the barrier with your wheel you risk of getting a puncture so you have to to the pit.I did not play much yet, but game is beautifull.I dont know if the ai cars are good or bad yet, but for my 1 race experience they drive good, though they several times crashed into me from behind and damage my car ;-(  very annoying.I did not try multiplayer, but i hope we "finaly" can see things fall off other cars.All in all look like a really good F1 games.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 24
												This is a very strong title from Codemasters and a notable successor to F1 2013. I haven't tested F1 2015 and played F1 2014 only on one ocassion but the general impression is to skip those - since these two games hold the best of what the series has to offer. Improvements over F1 2013 and highlights in general: the AI is more lively, more human, challenging, but also rarely it can make some stupid mistakes which result in unwanted collisions - this is mostly against the human player, and not between themselves - although the transition between a perfect drive from the AI and a costly mistake is there- and sometimes you will witness mistakes from the computer driven cars - even collisions which result in the safety car. They can even occur in qualifying and practice.  Found the difficulty level adjustments to scale just fine - and the balance between the different tracks on same difficulty to be spot on. Watching AI cars race themselves is entertaining - sometimes you see 3 cars wheel-to-wheel - fighting for position.  Virtual Safety Car implemented accordingly, no bugs encountered with VSC or regular safety car. AI players use different strategies in qualifying - choosing either the softest or the next tyre option in Q2 - to approach the race differently. Car upgrades make their presence felt - times improving from one season to another on the same track and also from one race to another. Live weather transitions during race - very well represented and offer variety in gameplay Adjustable FOV and zoom  Warm up lap for those who may need it - I didn't find it useful Collecting points in order to make upgrade - a nice minigame - but can get repetitive and uninteresting rather fast - I usually use the "Quali pace" program to test setups and the "Accomodation" program for some warm-up laps - to compare myself with the AI and also for setup testing opportunities. Playable just fine with a basic, cheap wheel with no force feedback - with all assists disabled - and NO TC! Even though it's a bit more hard than F1 2013 with no traction control, don't get discouraged! You just need to exercise a bit at first - since this game is a bit more unforgiving on the gas pedal when exiting corners - but it's nothing exagerated. (Saw some opinions which recommend to turn TC to Medium at least - I say don't use it at all - it will only spoil your experience in the long run and eventually you will want to play with it disabled - and competing at Expert level without TC is fully possible - as experienced by myself - Even in heavy rain - if you have a good setup - you can master controlling the gas pedal just fine and having no trouble without any TC)Room for improvement: Pitcrew pit strategy suggestions are often bad or badly timed - not bothering.  The animations in the garage - when you need to switch from the Overview to the Setup window is unuseful and repetitive in my opinion - and I would prefer no animation in between - so that transition delay is minimized. <-- This would be a great improvement - if transition animations between Overview and Setup screens can be disabled. The mainstream graphics effects which don't improve the experience: lens flare (the most horrible!), bloom, dirty lens, etc. which should be disabled - most of them disabled through turning off Postprocessing

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 17
												I have skipped the last F1 2015 due to mediocre reviews.I did hear good things about this one and when it went on sale the weekend of the new F1 season i took the chance to dive in.And man I am not disappointed, quite the opposite. Past games didnt have the details, the polish, many were quite buggy due to time pressure to release the game.You have 3 different Career modes which is great, the physics are great, the AI is very much improved from past games.In past games how my races usually ended up was starting at like place 17 because i like challenges and start with a slower car and work my way up.So i would start at 17 and because the AI in the past would be so slow, i would end up at like p5 after 1 lap but i didnt have a low difficulty, quite the opposte.What happens is, i get to 5, the cars in front distance themselves from me because I am a much slower car and the entire field would stick behind my♥♥♥♥♥because their pace is just that much faster, and I would not even drive that aggressively to get p5 after 1 lap, the AI was just that slow, so the races would always end up me trying to defend my place and getting outpaced by nearly the entire field.This game is different, a lot different. You can still make up many places at the first lap but I noticed there are a lot more "group of cars" meaning lets take my last race for example. I get from p6 to p4 in the first lap, one car would be right behind me, but then there would be a distance between that car and the ones behind while the Mercedes in front are just blasting off. Usually you won't have the entire field behind you waiting to pass you but rather 1-2 cars who match your pace a lot more than previous titles. I noticed i can overtake cars after 2 laps of the race because my pace would just be slightly better and the AI leaves you space, as you have to leave space for them, they dont ram you to death but rather expect you to let them pass like it would happen in real life. If you drive fair like them or a real F1 driver, the AI will be a lot of fun to drive against.I like the normal Career mode with the upgrading part, having these checkpoint,  tyre and qualification tests reward you for trying to practice a track and help you find the best line. I also on the Live TV feed watch the similarly fast AI and see which line they take if I notice im very slow in a perticular sector and then try to improve through that.I do not quite remember the previous parts but in this one you heavily notice the grip difference between the different tyres, you can see it visually when your tyre is at the end of his live, your driver has a face, you have many TV sequences like in the real League, it definitely does a great job putting life into your Career.Its greatly optimized, I have caught a little bug, on my 144hz Monitor and setting it up on 144hz it showed like huge black bars sometimes which made the game unplayable, tho this issue is entirely gone changing to 120hz.One little thing that I miss from past games is the Time Attack Challenge where the game offers some challenges where youd be put in a specific car on a specific track with specfic conditions, it is a great little indicator on how fast you are compared to your other F1 drivers, also i just really love time attack.In Conclusion, Codemasters have finally found the right formula, if they keep all the things theyve put in this one and just do their improvements year to year I will not complain but also they should then start to add more content, perhaps have 5 years of F1 car in a row in a special game or something but for now im very very happy with this game. Along with Codemasters own Dirt Rallye one of the best racing games I have played the last few years

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 11, 2016
												After scouring the internet and the codemasters official forum, I finally found a solution to the crash/freeze issue I have been having. Turing Particles OFF and shadows to low (everything thing else is HIGH) I am now able to race more than 10 laps. Before the game would freeze after 6 laps (consistently). For comparison, I tried the same thing in Dirt Rally and I am no longer having the same issue. So, I think it’s fairly conclusive that it’s an issue with the game engine. But on to the review. Now that I can finally race good stints without crashing the game is truly enjoyable. It is truly the best F1 title in the series. The presentation is spot on (they could do better with the faces but it’s all about the racing right), and I am enjoying the new career systems they have in place. I will say that I recommend this game but, be aware no matter what the benchmark test says if you are having issues you will have to tweak the settings until codemasters gets around to another patch. I'm hoping to upgrade to a 1070 soon so I will update again once I have that card. My current specs are; Win 10 ProIntel I-7 6700K32GB RAMGTX-970ASUS Maximus VIII Extreme

content:
Posted: April 16
												First of all, I have another 300 hours on this game on Xbox, 250 on f1 2015 on xbox. And 5++ on F1 2013 on PS3. Played F1 Games since 2011, and is possible the best game since F1 2013. Not the best game for begineers on pad, I would reccomend f1 2014 to someone on pad, or maybe even f1 2015, it takes a while to get used to this game on pad. My issue is you feel disconnected from the car and it is difficult to find the lmit of the car , whereas in f1 2013+ 14 you can find the limit of the car and it feels very enjoyable to drive.However, this game has aruably the best ever career mode in the game sereies. Now ith AI which are 100x better then we had ever seen before, with the 2 new extra difficulties, ultimate and master. Now also with a new padock feature, however without the all important interviews that I personally really want back. R&D now is the best and most adavnaced it has ever been now with R&D points, and now there is the ability to take the worst car on the grid the best car on the grid. The multiplayer is much improved over the last game in the series however it is still absolutely awful, and the standard of driving is off the ♥♥♥♥ing scale, it's so bad. If your gonna buy a game to play online get f1 2014, the game is still realitvely alive with a lesser amount of players on here than f1 2016 but that is to be expected really. This game maybe possible the best for new comers though, because a decent player on pad with assists will be faster than someone without assists. Your going ot have to work out the setup hack for yourself though, as I am not willing to just tell you how to get top 10 on the leaderboard by running assists.In conclusion, if your new to the series, but are expereinced on your platform of handling Eg: wheel or pad; this game will be for you. However, if you are interested in clean racing maybe sign up to a league or something, because you will still atleast alot clearner racing than in normal online and u won't be scared about making overtakes. If your new to racing games on the whole, I would not reccomend ot especially if you want to play online.Changed my mind never buy it. The online is complete and utt er ♥♥♥♥ing ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t, all people can do is take you out, cause ur faster than them, and then they think they're better than you and think they know the f1 rulebook better than you when they have supported f1 for 2 years and you have for your entire life.

												Well, still looking for a good racing game on PC.My brother insisted to try F1 2016 due to good reviews.We both try it, we both uninstalled it 30 minutes after.It's, i think, the worse F1 from codemaster :- Physic is broken using gamepad. You cannot handle countersteering with gaz assist off. With assist medium, oversteerring physic is a joke. With assist off, you cannot drive.- Direction is so strange and not fluid even after lot of settings- Graphic are clearly a console port on PC (asseto corsa is far much better) with rear view rendering in 320x200- No multiplayer collisions (phantom cars when you approach your mate)- All tire temperatures the same, driving like hell cannot raise the temperature, no inner/outer/middle temps.- Totally boring after 10 min, due to full gaz assist while drivingRefund.
